28#include <sys/cdefs.h>
29#ifndef lint
30__RCSID("$NetBSD: print-zeromq.c,v 1.3 2017/02/05 04:05:05 spz Exp $");
31#endif
32
33/* \summary: ZeroMQ Message Transport Protocol (ZMTP) printer */
34
35#ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
36#include "config.h"
37#endif
38
39#include <netdissect-stdinc.h>
40
41#include "netdissect.h"
42#include "extract.h"
43
44static const char tstr[] = " [|zmtp1]";
45
46/* Maximum number of ZMTP/1.0 frame body bytes (without the flags) to dump in
47 * hex and ASCII under a single "-v" flag.
48 */
49#define VBYTES 128
50
51/*
52 * Below is an excerpt from the "13/ZMTP" specification:
53 *
54 * A ZMTP message consists of 1 or more frames.
55 *
56 * A ZMTP frame consists of a length, followed by a flags field and a frame
57 * body of (length - 1) octets. Note: the length includes the flags field, so
58 * an empty frame has a length of 1.
59 *
60 * For frames with a length of 1 to 254 octets, the length SHOULD BE encoded
61 * as a single octet. The minimum valid length of a frame is 1 octet, thus a
62 * length of 0 is invalid and such frames SHOULD be discarded silently.
63 *
64 * For frames with lengths of 255 and greater, the length SHALL BE encoded as
65 * a single octet with the value 255, followed by the length encoded as a
66 * 64-bit unsigned integer in network byte order. For frames with lengths of
67 * 1 to 254 octets this encoding MAY be also used.
68 *
69 * The flags field consists of a single octet containing various control
70 * flags. Bit 0 is the least significant bit.
71 *
72 * - Bit 0 (MORE): More frames to follow. A value of 0 indicates that there
73 * are no more frames to follow. A value of 1 indicates that more frames
74 * will follow. On messages consisting of a single frame the MORE flag MUST
75 * be 0.
76 *
77 * - Bits 1-7: Reserved. Bits 1-7 are reserved for future use and SHOULD be
78 * zero.
79 */
80
81static const u_char *
82zmtp1_print_frame(netdissect_options *ndo, const u_char *cp, const u_char *ep)
83{
84 uint64_t body_len_declared, body_len_captured, header_len;
85 uint8_t flags;
86
87 ND_PRINT((ndo, "\n\t"));
88 ND_TCHECK2(*cp, 1); /* length/0xFF */
89
90 if (cp[0] != 0xFF) {
91 header_len = 1; /* length */
92 body_len_declared = cp[0];
93 ND_PRINT((ndo, " frame flags+body (8-bit) length %" PRIu64, body_len_declared));
94 } else {
95 header_len = 1 + 8; /* 0xFF, length */
96 ND_PRINT((ndo, " frame flags+body (64-bit) length"));
97 ND_TCHECK2(*cp, header_len); /* 0xFF, length */
98 body_len_declared = EXTRACT_64BITS(cp + 1);
99 ND_PRINT((ndo, " %" PRIu64, body_len_declared));
100 }
101 if (body_len_declared == 0)
102 return cp + header_len; /* skip to the next frame */
103 ND_TCHECK2(*cp, header_len + 1); /* ..., flags */
104 flags = cp[header_len];
105
106 body_len_captured = ep - cp - header_len;
107 if (body_len_declared > body_len_captured)
108 ND_PRINT((ndo, " (%" PRIu64 " captured)", body_len_captured));
109 ND_PRINT((ndo, ", flags 0x%02x", flags));
110
111 if (ndo->ndo_vflag) {
112 uint64_t body_len_printed = min(body_len_captured, body_len_declared);
113
114 ND_PRINT((ndo, " (%s|%s|%s|%s|%s|%s|%s|%s)",
115 flags & 0x80 ? "MBZ" : "-",
116 flags & 0x40 ? "MBZ" : "-",
117 flags & 0x20 ? "MBZ" : "-",
118 flags & 0x10 ? "MBZ" : "-",
119 flags & 0x08 ? "MBZ" : "-",
120 flags & 0x04 ? "MBZ" : "-",
121 flags & 0x02 ? "MBZ" : "-",
122 flags & 0x01 ? "MORE" : "-"));
123
124 if (ndo->ndo_vflag == 1)
125 body_len_printed = min(VBYTES + 1, body_len_printed);
126 if (body_len_printed > 1) {
127 ND_PRINT((ndo, ", first %" PRIu64 " byte(s) of body:", body_len_printed - 1));
128 hex_and_ascii_print(ndo, "\n\t ", cp + header_len + 1, body_len_printed - 1);
129 ND_PRINT((ndo, "\n"));
130 }
131 }
132
133 /*
134 * Do not advance cp by the sum of header_len and body_len_declared
135 * before each offset has successfully passed ND_TCHECK2() as the
136 * sum can roll over (9 + 0xfffffffffffffff7 = 0) and cause an
137 * infinite loop.
138 */
139 cp += header_len;
140 ND_TCHECK2(*cp, body_len_declared); /* Next frame within the buffer ? */
141 return cp + body_len_declared;
142
143trunc:
144 ND_PRINT((ndo, "%s", tstr));
145 return ep;
146}
147
148void
149zmtp1_print(netdissect_options *ndo, const u_char *cp, u_int len)
150{
151 const u_char *ep = min(ndo->ndo_snapend, cp + len);
152
153 ND_PRINT((ndo, ": ZMTP/1.0"));
154 while (cp < ep)
155 cp = zmtp1_print_frame(ndo, cp, ep);
156}
157
158/* The functions below decode a ZeroMQ datagram, supposedly stored in the "Data"
159 * field of an ODATA/RDATA [E]PGM packet. An excerpt from zmq_pgm(7) man page
160 * follows.
161 *
162 * In order for late joining consumers to be able to identify message
163 * boundaries, each PGM datagram payload starts with a 16-bit unsigned integer
164 * in network byte order specifying either the offset of the first message frame
165 * in the datagram or containing the value 0xFFFF if the datagram contains
166 * solely an intermediate part of a larger message.
167 *
168 * Note that offset specifies where the first message begins rather than the
169 * first message part. Thus, if there are trailing message parts at the
170 * beginning of the packet the offset ignores them and points to first initial
171 * message part in the packet.
172 */
173
174static const u_char *
175zmtp1_print_intermediate_part(netdissect_options *ndo, const u_char *cp, const u_int len)
176{
177 u_int frame_offset;
178 uint64_t remaining_len;
179
180 ND_TCHECK2(*cp, 2);
181 frame_offset = EXTRACT_16BITS(cp);
182 ND_PRINT((ndo, "\n\t frame offset 0x%04x", frame_offset));
183 cp += 2;
184 remaining_len = ndo->ndo_snapend - cp; /* without the frame length */
185
186 if (frame_offset == 0xFFFF)
187 frame_offset = len - 2; /* always within the declared length */
188 else if (2 + frame_offset > len) {
189 ND_PRINT((ndo, " (exceeds datagram declared length)"));
190 goto trunc;
191 }
192
193 /* offset within declared length of the datagram */
194 if (frame_offset) {
195 ND_PRINT((ndo, "\n\t frame intermediate part, %u bytes", frame_offset));
196 if (frame_offset > remaining_len)
197 ND_PRINT((ndo, " (%"PRIu64" captured)", remaining_len));
198 if (ndo->ndo_vflag) {
199 uint64_t len_printed = min(frame_offset, remaining_len);
200
201 if (ndo->ndo_vflag == 1)
202 len_printed = min(VBYTES, len_printed);
203 if (len_printed > 1) {
204 ND_PRINT((ndo, ", first %"PRIu64" byte(s):", len_printed));
205 hex_and_ascii_print(ndo, "\n\t ", cp, len_printed);
206 ND_PRINT((ndo, "\n"));
207 }
208 }
209 }
210 return cp + frame_offset;
211
212trunc:
213 ND_PRINT((ndo, "%s", tstr));
214 return cp + len;
215}
216
217void
218zmtp1_print_datagram(netdissect_options *ndo, const u_char *cp, const u_int len)
219{
220 const u_char *ep = min(ndo->ndo_snapend, cp + len);
221
222 cp = zmtp1_print_intermediate_part(ndo, cp, len);
223 while (cp < ep)
224 cp = zmtp1_print_frame(ndo, cp, ep);
225}
